website_summaries.verdict: A trustworthy and economical investment. You can't go wrong owning one or more of these handy nonstick pans.
pros: Quick-release nonstick coating for easy food retrieval
Comes from a popular line of kitchen pans
cons: Pans must be washed by hand

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding me?! These pans are AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: These pans are without a doubt the most solid, well-built and best performing bread pans I have ever used in my short baking life. Just feeling the heft of these pans tell you they mean business! I baked my first loaves yesterday with these pans and they turned out amazing. I can't recommend these pans more. I think I'll get two more! :)
customer_reviews.author: MAINEiac

customer_reviews.title: One time use?
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy structure but impossible to clean. The folds of the pan allow batter/dough to become trapped in the crevasses. I tried to soak the pan in hot water but all it did was discolor and rust the pan.
customer_reviews.author: HondaMoney

customer_reviews.title: No don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I would return, but bought it as an add on so not worth it. Once washed, this pan bled rust from the corners. I wouldn’t chance trying to use it now! Bad pan, unless you want rust in your food..
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but peels!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pan but after the 3rd use it started peeling. In the trash it went!
customer_reviews.author: J. Olive

customer_reviews.title: Feels like it was made to last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: There's not a lot to say about this pan that hasn't already been said. When I took it out of the box, I actually said "wow!". This feels like a product from a bygone age, back when things were made to last. This thing has some serious heft to it. Sure, you can find less expensive bread pans, but not of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: SeriousKeto

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Professional Bread Pan
customer_reviews.text: You will never need to buy another bread pan again! This is a professional-grade, heavy duty pan. The corrugated sides and bottom let air circulate during the baking process. The corrugated sides and bottom will not be evident on your finished bread. Although I always use a baking spray, this pan has a long lasting coating for quick release of your newly baked bread. Once I was making several loaves of bread and forgot to prepare the pan but I was further impressed with this pan when the second loaf was released just a easily as the first. This is the pan you will use when your recipe calls for three cups of flour.
customer_reviews.author: Alice M. GroveTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: What happened to American pride?!
customer_reviews.text: The product does not do as it states. The clear coating is peeling even though cleaning has ONLY been done by hand and I have not even used the product ten times yet. I spent more purchasing this because I wanted to support an American company, but American companies no longer take pride in themselves and no longer produce quality products. I guess I will look for countries of origin other than China, but not the USA either.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan

customer_reviews.title: Garbage now.
customer_reviews.text: Rusts and hard to clean in the corners, Garbage now.
customer_reviews.author: Auti

customer_reviews.title: Now my favorite bread pan
customer_reviews.text: This bread pan made a nice loaf the first time I used it. And the baked bread just falls out of the pan, with almost no cleaning needed. I bake gluten-free bread, which is not so easy to get right, and I've used several different pans, but this pan worked so well it is now my favorite. I keep it stored in a plastic bag to prevent the finish from getting scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Hogen(greatv) Bays

customer_reviews.title: It Rusts
customer_reviews.text: The pan holds water in the folded sections, which caused it to rust after the first wash. Now it's trash. It's a shame because the single use I got out of it was pretty good, but with a design flaw this severe that could have been avoided by just using a more basic design, I have to recommend people steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, impossible to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this pan the first time I used it. Heavy, naturally nonstick, perfect size. That feeling lasted until I took it out of the cabinet to use it for the second time a few weeks later. The construction created folds, and there is no way to avoid water being retained in those folds and then reappearing as rusty, dirty spots in all of the corners. Looks like a major design flaw. Ruins an otherwise excellent tool.
customer_reviews.author: D. Goggans

customer_reviews.title: Ordered NEW and received USED
customer_reviews.text: I ordered NEW pans and received one new and one opened with a scratch. The wrapping was loosely wrapped around the pan with no sticker that specified NEW. I might have overlooked and kept it if it wasn't for the scratch, which will most likely rust. Now I have to go through the hassle of returning and waiting for the correct product. Very dissapointed!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa White

customer_reviews.title: Solid pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made, solid construction bread pan. I use this pan when I make sourdough sandwich bread (mainly) and it’s just a smidge too narrow for what I need. But! The pan is great and incredibly easy to clean. I worried the folded over edge look would catch junk and be hard to wash out, but thankfully I was wrong about that.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: Impossibly to clean the sides!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice Pan! I like the non stick coating inside. Even heat distribution BUT, it’s impossible to clean the sides inside the pan, the batter gets trapped there, even after you wash it well, I have to clean each corner with a tooth pick. Also water gets trapped in there & under the folds on the outside too. I believe i am gonna be seeing rust soon on it too from all the trapped water that I can’t get to. Too bad cuz it’s a really nice heavy duty pan but the cleaning part is very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: G R

customer_reviews.title: Rust?
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even used the pan once; just washed it, and the corners are already rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Leto

customer_reviews.title: the rust...
customer_reviews.text: I received my order yesterday. When I opened the package and washed this pan before use, this pan bled rust from the corners. I wouldn’t risk trying to use it now unless you want your food with rust. I am not happy about the rust.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: What a lovely pan!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was recommended on a website called An Oregon Cottage. It is a bit smaller than the standard 9x5 inch pan. This one is 4.5x8.5 inches. That small difference allows my bread to rise a bit higher than larger loaf pans. Heat distribution in this pan is excellent. Cleanup is a breeze but it should be noted that hand washing is the order of the day. Manufacturer is clear that this pan must be washed by hand. I imagine the alkaline ingredients in dishwasher detergents would ruin the surface of this pan.
customer_reviews.author: JJO

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bread Pan!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pan! Many of my bread recipes call for the smaller size pan but I couldn’t find one locally. I was worried this would be hard to clean but it is super easy (though I recommend during in the oven after cleaning to get the water out of the corners). The design does indeed (as they warn) cook bread faster than other pans I’ve used but it is a nice, even, beautiful bake. Just the perfect pan that does exactly what it should!
customer_reviews.author: Jcat

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.text: I can't figure out how this pan gets so many five-star reviews. I really want to like this pan. I haven't had rusting issues like other reviews I've read — yet. But my problem is that everything I bake takes twice as long in the oven. I made banana bread the first time I used it, which should have taken about 55 min. to an hour, but it took over 1-1/2 hours to bake, and even after I took it out of the oven it was still a little underbaked. This happens with every quick bread I've baked in this pan.
customer_reviews.author: J. Langlois

customer_reviews.title: My second USA bread pan purchase: outstanding quality.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned the USA Pullman pan for several years, use it frequently, and it is excellent. Perfect size, has not warped, and the surface is virtually non-stick (when trying a new recipe, if I’m uncertain of the dough, I might put in a parchment lifter, but I’ve never had to do so twice). I do take good care of it, always washing by hand—which is easy because there’s never any dough glued to it. So far, its younger sibling, which replaced an ancient, really bad small bread pan, has performed exactly as expected. What took me so long???
customer_reviews.author: Mary C.Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pans to cook bread.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these pans to cook home bread during this situation. We have been experimenting with bread cooking for more than two months and it's great. With the pans it is really easy since the bread gets a nice shape and a crust is created because of the contact with the pan. After we got this couple of pans we bought another from the same brand but bigger for sandwich bread. Each week we cook a different kind of bread with cilantro, almonds, garlic, and other ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Cui Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Best pans we have tried
customer_reviews.text: Great pans-- if you have any KAF (King Arthur Flour) bakeware, this is the same product with a different branding. The quality is excellent and stands the test of time. My wife and I have been using the 9x5 pans for years and they look the same as when we bought them (still churning out quickbreads like a champ).
customer_reviews.author: Jon Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS PAN
customer_reviews.text: I love this loaf pan! I only use it for bread and it bakes a lovely 1.5 pound loaf with perfect crust inside the pan. Easy to clean, heavy duty, good heat distribution. I do not wash with soap and water but I do rinse with hot water and towel dry it. I also stack other pans inside it for storage, but I put a paper towel liner in it to revent scratching. The surface is durable and I probably don't have to go to all the trouble, but I believe with care this pan should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: outdoorsgirl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this because it was actually made in the USA. However, after reading other reviews, I must agree that having seams inside of the pan caused water to pool behind the seams and get rusty. No matter how quickly I dried the pan after washing, it continued to seep water from the seams. I decided it wasn’t worth it so I returned it and got a different seamless version from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Hognfrog

customer_reviews.title: Instant-release quality: Beyond expecations
customer_reviews.text: Bread baking, rolls, etc. - not bonding to the pan after baking is a god-send. Yet rarely achieved. These USA Pan Bakeware products deliver outstanding release-results, far beyond expectations. Every instance meant simply turning the pan upside down. Instant out! Most remarkable is egg-washes applied to baked bread that dribbled over into the sides of the pan - never a hint at sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase these pans!
customer_reviews.text: I made meatloaf in this pan and when I hand-washed it, there was still meatloaf in the corners. I used a thin knife with a cloth to remove the food, but it is still in the corners and it looks like rust as well. The company makes wonderful 9x13 baking pans, but this design is terrible and food will get stuck in the crevices.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Old time quality made in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: The pan is lovely-heavy and with a quality of cookware I associate with times gone by. The only thing I was surprised to see was that the pan is not one piece of metal, but has a seam at each corner, where food can enter the crack. That is easily cleaned out with a toothpick if the need arises and I would much rather do that and have my cookware made right here in the good old USA! I have made cakes and meatloaves in these pans and they work like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: MejiroBird

customer_reviews.title: BEST bread pan
customer_reviews.text: I've dabbled in bread baking off and on for about 40 years. I'm not an expert, by any means, but I've used many different types of bread pans over the years. This pan is by far and away the BEST. Its sturdy, heavy duty, easy to clean (although DO pay special attention to the corners) and the baked bread comes out easily. I recommend this to novice bakers and experts alike.
customer_reviews.author: C. Keibler

customer_reviews.title: Not completelt non stick for me
customer_reviews.text: I do like the heaviness of these pans. They bake my bread evenly and my loaves are nicely browned. However my bread does stick a little. The loaves don't just "pop" out of the pans. I have to run a straight edge around them. Sometimes they stick quite a bit. I've resisted using cooking spray because I afraid there will be residue in the ridges that will be difficult to clean. So, i just deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great Bread Pan
customer_reviews.text: Great bread pan. I love this pan. I use this all the time along with the USA Pullman Pan. This pan is well made, cleans easily and bakes evenly on all sides. The bread never sticks to the pan. I like it so much, this and the Pullman pans are the only bread pans I use now, and I just purchased the 2/2.5 lb sized loaf pan as well. This pan makes bread baking a whole lot easier. It's also very easy to clean, it's well made and durable. This is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoying this pan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan after seeing it recommended on a blog and reading the reviews. I have baked with it a couple of times so far, including a zucchini loaf and a lemon cake. Both of them came out fantastic, were easy to slide out of the pan and the pan was easy to clean. I am so impressed I just picked up another USA Pan in a different size/shape and hope I enjoy it just as much.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple cleanup! Excellent baking! Love these pans.
customer_reviews.text: I bake sourdough bread for neighbors and those who are homebound. Usually I bake 8 loaves a week, so I have 4 of these loaf pans. It was shocking to see I don't even need to oil the pans. The bread just slides out! Cleanup is an absolute breeze. I just wipe them out with a paper towel. When making a meat loaf, it continues to be an easy cleanup, but I do use soap and water and a soft cloth. Remember...no greasing of the pans and simple cleanup and even cooking. It doesn't get any better than this!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Pickle

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, nice, sturdy loaf pan, but I don’t care for the folded corners, too hard to clean up.
customer_reviews.text: I had never used this type of loaf pan, with the “folded” corners. Bakes evenly, beautifully— but corners “seep”, hard to get clean.
customer_reviews.author: Joye Meeker

customer_reviews.title: I Give UP - Too Difficult to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I feel I must express my disappointment in this product from USA Pan. I own several of their products and like them but I decided to give up on this loaf pan because it is almost impossible to clean thoroughly. I should not have to use toothpicks to get crumbs and residue form the corners because they are not completely joined together. I have been very happy with the results from using this pan to bake, but today I ordered a pan from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.Chartrain

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pans
customer_reviews.text: I had these pans a little time now. I made rye, Italian and Amish breads with them and didn't experience any problems. No sticking. Cooks evenly. I also use it for a meatloaf. They work well, except they are tough to handle when removing the bread. Gripping the pan to turn over is difficult. I put the pan on its side and let the bread side out. Then turn the bread upright.
customer_reviews.author: Product User

customer_reviews.title: Best bread pan!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic pans! I had stoneware pans before this that I thought I loved but now I love this pan more. My bread rises better than ever and slides out of this pan so easily. I've only used it for yeast breads so haven't had the issues others have had with quick breads. I use this exclusively for yeast breads and it stays nice and clean.
customer_reviews.author: ClaraTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Non Stick for real.
customer_reviews.text: I bake bread all the time. You almost don't need to wash it it releases so nice. I never have to do the butter/flour trick or non stick spray. I don't use anything except the pan itself. I do banana bread or regular bread. USA makes the best non stick products. I use the cookie sheets as well. Just rinse them.
customer_reviews.author: cabmansgal

customer_reviews.title: Great pans!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using USA pans for years and this time I wanted the smaller 8x4 pans for my quick breads. They make it easy to remove the breads after baking and I always let them cool 10 minutes before removing breads to a rack. I have never put them in the dish washer so as not to remove the non-stick surface. I will purchase more for my holiday baking.
customer_reviews.author: geeb

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for yeast breads
customer_reviews.text: I get so many compliments for the loaves I make in this pan, due to the crisp, professional-looking edges. Perfect for handmade yeast bread - most “loaf pans” are meant for banana bread and will make a yeast loaf (using 500g flour) look flat and sad. The slightly smaller dimensions of this pan mean you get a nice round dome over the edges, like a cartoon image of bread! The bread pops out really easily, making it quick to check whether it’s done. I’ve used the pans several times now and have no complaints. They seem sturdy and I am confident I’ll be using them for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pan, a Bit Hard to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan to make banana bread it worked wonderfully! Heat distribution was even and when I inverted the pan, the loaf popped right out. My only complaint, as I've seen others mention, is that it is hard to clean out the folded corners. I let it soak in warm water for a few hours and used the kitchen sprayer to try and blast out the stuck in crumbs, but it was impossible to get everything. I didn't want to scrub and ruin the silicon coating. It's not really a big deal, just a bit annoying. Pan great overall, though.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer1994

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after one use
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once and found rust in the corners. Apparently, drying it like other dishes means that water still collects in the folded steel and rusts. Impossible to get all the water out with a towel. I'm disappointed that Amazon would recommend this as the best.
customer_reviews.author: Lululunu

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning corners
customer_reviews.text: The seams on each corner where food and liquids get caught. I made banana bread, washed it, and it still smelled of it. I stuck a brush in the corners but in the dish rack it dripped banana bread flavor. I’ll reserve this pan for meatloaf from now on and try the dishwasher next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENTO
customer_reviews.text: This pan is so wonderful I have used it so so many times for baking and it never ever sticks I had a recipe for red velvet pound cake and it said to lined the pan with aluminum foil and it cake out perfect. For those of you who loved to bake get this pan it won't let you down.
customer_reviews.author: Chilies

customer_reviews.title: Breadilicious
customer_reviews.text: I've only baked one loaf of bread in it so far and it did a great job. They recommended you don't use any baking spray like Pam, so I took a paper towel and wiped it with a little cooking oil. The bread came out a nice even color and the bread baked evenly and released from the pan easily. So can't complain. I think it's a one pound loaf pan but it easily held my one and half pound plain white loaf.
customer_reviews.author: C Merle

customer_reviews.title: open folds in the side plates on the inside
customer_reviews.text: I figured a pan made in the U.S.A. would be constructed better than this. Sheet metal folds on the inside of the pan allows food and germ buildup in corners!
customer_reviews.author: BookWorm

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: This pan bakes well and provides even heat. However, after the first use/wash, the non-stick coating immediately came off, and the pan started rusting. I only used a non-abrasive sponge to wash the pan, and I didn't use any metal utensils with the pan during the baking process. The quality of this pan is disappointing, and it's a safety concern that the coating comes off so easily.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Great pans! But the coating on mine is coming off!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great pan...until the coating started coming off. These pans work great. I have made a lot of bread in them. Nothing ever stuck in them and they baked things nicely. However, recently the coating has started to come off in spots. This leads to the pan rusting when it is washed. I was really disappointed to see this happening because these were my favorite pans.
customer_reviews.author: Derek H

customer_reviews.title: Great bread pans
customer_reviews.text: This was my third one. I have a sour dough starter and usually bake 3 loaves of bread at a time. These are by far the best pans I have used. The bread comes right out of the pan with a crispy nicely browned crust. They are hand wash only and I dry them upside down so any water left in the corners runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasagna
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to make lasagna in. It worked like a charm. Cooked evenly, and lasagna was easy to remove. Easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Squeak

customer_reviews.title: Great pan and price
customer_reviews.text: The pan works as it's supposed too. I'll pass on a tip that I read in one of the reviews. Water gets caught in the cracks and eventually starts to rust. Recommend washing right away and put in the oven while it's still warm to thoroughly dry things. So far, so good. The easy fix for a pan that does the job and doesn't cost a lot.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy removal/clean but maybe uneven heating?
customer_reviews.text: This came with several scratches inside each corner of the bread pan, assuming these are the quality nowadays? Anyway I was super excited to use this, the bread loaf slide right out and it very easy to clean. However my second loaf was baked very unevenly, the same dough was fluffy on one end but the other end had all the dough slumped together. Will try to bake a few times more and update if this was an one-off issue.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Amazing loaf pans!!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST BEST BEST loaf pans ever. Great heat retention and distribution. Bread practically falls out of the non-stick pans. I bake bread once or twice a week and these loaf pans are a critical part of my process.
customer_reviews.author: jrm37'fugitive

customer_reviews.title: Rust!
customer_reviews.text: The pan rusts. The inside corners can hold water after washing and it is nearly impose to dry them. So they rust. This is a design flaw since the folds are not sealed causing the rusting problem. I like the pan but wouldn't buy it again or a similar product.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Frugal, Scratch-cooking, Mama review
customer_reviews.text: Hefty little loaf pan! My first USA pan purchase and not my last. I have started myself a little sinking fund to next acquire myself s'more. Sometimes it's too easy to remove and it's too slippery! I worry I might lose my loaf, but that also makes them practically self-cleaning! Cannot wait to try more!
customer_reviews.author: Ally Troyer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this pan!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing bread pan! I can't believe I've ever used anything else. There's something about the coating which makes the loaves of bread slide out immediately, easily, perfectly, every time. The bread cooks well and evenly. I know it's more expensive than other pans, but it's like using a NASA rocket to get to the moon instead of your 30-year-old VW Bug. It's the right tool.
customer_reviews.author: S. Singer

customer_reviews.title: After a Year of Heavy Use, still 💯
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these pans for over a year and only recently had to start spraying them down (might also be bc I’m making high hydration whole grain breads). I bake at least four loaves a week. I actually just tried a cheaper pan bc I want to start baking bread in bulk and it was terrible. I’m definitely a customer for life 👍
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Best pan ever!  Made in the USA! 🇺🇸
customer_reviews.text: Made in America! Best pan I’ve used. Corn bread, bread, cake, it all falls out perfectly. Heat distribution is perfect. Cleans with no effort. Feels good to the touch. Sturdy. I plan to buy more shapes and sizes! BEST!
customer_reviews.author: Nonna

customer_reviews.title: Simple is Always Better
customer_reviews.text: I am not a bread maker by any stretch of the imagination and this product was recommended by a recipe. I was surprised at how heavy and simply made this product was....No frills, just exactly what was needed. It is GREAT quality and extremely easy to clean. It is also Made in the USA which made me happy because I felt like maybe I was contributing to a small business that was affected during this pandemic. Anyway, happy to have it now and am continuing to work on my bread making skills :)
customer_reviews.author: SNMZ

customer_reviews.title: You need this pan!
customer_reviews.text: Best pan I've ever used! Beautiful baking with an exceptional crust, easy release and easy to clean. It's heavy and will last a lifetime! This is an heirloom piece for certain!
customer_reviews.author: LB in the OC

customer_reviews.title: Great pan!
customer_reviews.text: This pan was recommended for the gluten free bread recipe that I make & it works great. I don't think I've ever had a bread pan that released the bread so easily. I actually purchased another one of these to give to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bread Pan
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used this pan once for bread, but it performed beautifully. The bread came out well risen and perfectly browned. I can't speak to long-term durability, but allowing for the fact that it's silicone coated and you can't use metal utensils, I expect it to last a long time. I have other USA Pan baking pans and I'm very happy with all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Great pans at a great price
customer_reviews.text: These pans are phenomenal! I bake a lot of bread: challah, zucchini, banana, cinnamon raisin, wheat... The pans make a nice crust. Th bread releases easily. And clean up is fast.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Love

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy bread pan. Heats evenly, doesn’t stick and there is no coating that gets scraped off. Don’t waste your money on non-stick pans. For a few dollars more, this will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: NtY

customer_reviews.title: This is a case of getting what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: Although this baking pan was twice as expensive as others that I could have purchased, its high quality in manufacturing and good results in baking make this pan well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Phil-thom

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, BUY A BRUSH TO CLEAN ITS CORNERS!
customer_reviews.text: Product was relatively easy to clean, however each of the 4 four corners will need to be scrubbed with a brush. Bread gets stuck in the folds and it will not just rinse or wash out with a sponge or towel.
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bread pan!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bread pan! Bread slipped right out and baked evenly. My only complaint is that it's a little hard to clean crumbs out of the inside where the metal folds a bit. If you rinse right away, it wouldn't be a problem. I would recommend this product and I'm thinking of ordering another!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with no blemishes, dents, etc. Heavier than I expected, which is good. Well made loaf pans - exactly what you're expecting when you look at the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Brent L. Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: I have used these to bake pound cakes, banana brand, etc. and I have been very happy with them. They produce a great product. I haven't put them in the dishwasher because I don't want to ruin the finish and want to preserve the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Loved these loaf pans. I started baking bread and these were recommended by the author of the recipe book I've been following. Made well, even heat distribution and easy to clean. I would buy again when I need to, however, I think these will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Musgrave

customer_reviews.title: Cannot dry or clean properly
customer_reviews.text: The pan has interior folds that make it impossible to clean or dry properly. It's a shame because it does appear to be a quality build with just this design flaw (see other reviews/pictures for more information).
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: The pan is more than I expected Don’t even need to clean, it stays clean Easy to remove, wonderful heat distribution Will replace most of my pans with USA Pan
customer_reviews.author: Elena N

customer_reviews.title: Best Loaf Pan I've seen
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Feels like professional weight. My novice baking skills were very happy with the results of my first Banana Bread. I don't think you can go wrong at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Superb loaf pan
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these pans at a kitchen because my other loaf pans were the wrong size for what I needed. Seemed like a good pan when I used it. Then, about three weeks ago, I made bread. OMG the difference between this pan and my old loaf pans. I tossed all of my old pans and bought another one of these pans! The results from this pan is incredible. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shorty McAwesome

customer_reviews.title: I’m buying more of these
customer_reviews.text: Love this Pam! Light metal keeps my bread from burning and it’s texture makes it virtually non stick. It has a heavy feel to it that Makes me think it will last for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Tevis

customer_reviews.title: More USA pans to our collection!
customer_reviews.text: We've added this to our many other USA Pan bakeware we already have. The only complaint is that the openings in the corners need to be cleaned out with a toothpick or toothbrush. I wish they weren't there. But, these are nice and heavy duty and should last a long time. They bake evenly and clean easily except for the corners mentioned above.
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: Everything and more. High end, super durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bossy bread pan. Non stick coated so I definitely do recommend slicing anything while it’s in the pan but if you are looking for a sourdough or sandwich bread pan to survive the ages I’m pretty sure this bad boy could survive a nuclear holocaust. It’s heavy, look and feels like major quality. I’m buying a few more I don’t want to be without one.
customer_reviews.author: Riian

customer_reviews.title: Best pan I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit of a crazy bread lady, as in, I grind my own flour crazy. I have tried many different bread pans, including the william sonoma gold-touch, and this is by far the best. I will never buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pan
customer_reviews.text: This was a major upgrade from my old bread pan. The rivets make bread removal quite easy and my bread has a better, stronger shape to it. I'm buying a second!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Love this for bread!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is excellent - my bakes bake so evenly. My only complaint is the lack of handles. But the nonstick is so effective that loaves usually just slide right out.
customer_reviews.author: Magpie

customer_reviews.title: Best loaf pan
customer_reviews.text: This has definitely got to be the best loaf pan. The cake bakes perfectly and evenly and comes out so clean. I make pretty good marble cakes with this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Garima Anand

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan!!!
customer_reviews.text: I made pumpkin ginger spice bread and these cooked perfectly and came out easily. No need for any cooking spray or other coating in pan.
customer_reviews.author: Julia & Fred

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, sturdy, family owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for baking sourdough bread and loved it. I have been using it for over a year. With yeasted breads, the bread comes right out and the pan washes clean easily. Because of the depth, I prefer to add parchment paper if I am using it for loaf cakes or quick breads. The finish has stayed intact, no issues with rust or flaking. I will buy again from this brand. The thicker metal means it distributes heat much better than other loaf pans. I think it will last me a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Emma Morgen Stocker

customer_reviews.title: Superb transaction!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pans, I make my own Gluten Free Bread so these pans come in so handy! Thank you so much!! Fast shipping, No fuss transaction!
customer_reviews.author: turtle

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty pans. Nice shaped loaves. Used parchment for easy removal, but I think it would slip out fairly easily without it because of the texture.
customer_reviews.author: elle b

customer_reviews.title: Best pan for bread
customer_reviews.text: One caution DO NOT put in the dishwasher. Wipe out with a damp cloth, dry. I use mine with parchment paper, bread comes out easily
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Young

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Non-Stick
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy metal, bakes evenly, and best of all it is super easy to remove your loaf after baking. I just flip it over and it falls out! Almost zero crumbs left behind too.
customer_reviews.author: Sydreviews

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bread pan
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing pan! I was considering buying a bread pan from King Arthur Flour till I realized that premier pan makes the pan for them and it's much cheaper on Amazon. All my bread bakes nice and even with no spots that are over browned. Sometimes I grease this pan and other times I don't. Each time the loaf slides right out with no problems. I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase. The pan is nice and heavy and is a very good quality. I look forward to buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: machayla

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great bread pan. I love the sharp edges as it makes for a beautiful loaf. The grooves don’t show on the bread. If you take care of it, it will surely last a life time.
customer_reviews.author: Random Stranger

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Just a terrific loaf pan. Well made from great material. I've only used mine for bread so far but for that it worked flawlessly. No hot spots and the loaf popped right out. Nice heavyweight, I like it very much.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy N.

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. Well worth paying a bit more for a quality product made in USA. Built solidly and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: It may work for you but it didn’t for me. I had to return it. It’s way too small. But the quality is excellent and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Rafaele C.

customer_reviews.title: Made a nice loaf of bread
customer_reviews.text: This is a good size for me since the one I have is tad bigger than I want it to be. Material feels great and overall sturdy and trust it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pan, solid construction and even heat distribution. It’s much better than I expected for my first “quarantine” loaves of bread. An absolute dream!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: I can not get this pan clean
customer_reviews.text: I made a blueberry cobbler. The juice seeped down in the seams and I cannot get it all out. I washed and dried it and set it aside but it is still leaking juice. I missed the return window. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: M Hicks

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and well made. Loaf came out easily. A quick wash and dry then putting in the oven to finish drying while the oven cools keeps it great. Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: My bread comes out so beautifully. Clean up of these pans is a breeze ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these pans just about every week. My bread comes out so beautifully. Clean up of these pans is a breeze as nothing seems to stick to them. No need to grease the pans prior to baking as they are left clean after use. I just wash them lightly with soap and water and dry them thoroughly to wait for the next use. I was thinking about purchasing the pans from Williams Sonoma, but I found out that USA pans makes their pans. I have these loaf pans in both sizes and absolutely adore them.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy SumnerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: This is great. Seems small but I made banana nut bread ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great. Seems small but I made banana nut bread and came out great. No spraying just slipped right out! It is heavy so will last. No liquids as it did leak if only water but not the bread mixture. (Homemade)
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: This pan has substantial weight and a smooth silicone coating to prevent sticking. It's a pleasure to use. One caution is that metal utensils cannot be used because of the coating.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Love these USA Pullman pans!
customer_reviews.text: Terrific Pans! I have several types of USA pans and they're all great. I sprout my own (hard white) wheat berries and grind them into flour right before bread baking. I wanted a loaf that actually held together for a sandwich with a denser crumb, thinner crust and squared for toast. These pans made all that possible with just a few modifications to my usual recipe. I use 1.75# (28 ounces) of dough per loaf in the 8.5 x 4.5 pans, if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Loaf Pan
customer_reviews.text: This pan is wonderful! Heat distribution is excellent with no hot spots or underbaked areas. Baked goods readily release, & it is easy to clean. I wish I'd bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: crazyquiltmom

product_meta.title: USA Pan Bakeware Aluminized Steel Loaf Pan, 1 Pound, Silver
product_meta.description: The USA Pan 1 pound Loaf Pan measures a full 8.5 x 4.5 x 2.75 inches* and provides home bakers with an easy way to bake the perfect quick bread, flawless pound cake, super moist cornbread, or classic meatloaf. Bake top quality artisan breads that come out finished with beautifully flaky crust. An extremely versatile kitchen accessory, the USA Pan’s 1 pound Loaf Pan can also be used for everything from no-crust quiches, to delicious chicken pot pies. With a patented AMERICOAT Plus non-stick coating, the USA Pan 1 pound Loaf Pan allows for easy clean-up and truly effortless release of your baked items. AMERICOAT Plus is also PTFE, PFOA, and BPA free. Every USA Pan is made in the USA and has been designed with the same standard high performance features that commercial bakers enjoy including aluminized steel and heavy gauge steel construction that allows for even heat distribution and maximum service life. The USA Pan 1 Pound Loaf Pan also features a steel wire in the rim, which provides extra strength and further provides resistance to warping. The USA Pan 1 pound Loaf Pan's unique fluted surface design facilitates air circulation and also maximizes pan strength, which helps to resist warping. USA Pan’s professional grade bakeware helps everyday home bakers produce professional grade baked goods. USA Pan bakeware is long-lasting, durable, reliable, and comes with a limited lifetime warranty. USA Pan is a Bundy Family owned company, based in the Greater Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania area that has been producing high performance bakeware for over 50 years. *Dimensions represent baking surface, not overall pan size.
feature_bullets: Made in the USA from globally sourced materials; aluminized steel 1 pound loaf pan, commercial grade and heavy gauge - measures 8. 5 x 4. 5 x 2. 75 inch
Unique corrugated surface design facilitates air circulation for evenly baked goods and quick release
Coated with Americoat - a silicone that is PTFE, PFOA and BPA free
Made with a blend of New and recycled steel; Limited life-time
USA Pan is a Bundy family company that has proudly manufactured high quality bakeware and provided jobs in the USA for over 50 years
